subjectDescription: Discover a full suite of online business courses that will allow you to make better business decisions and succeed in today's competitive business world. Our courses provide a rich learning experience that will allow you to develop critical business skills in areas such as business... Read more...
title: Diploma in Interior Design
headline: This free online diploma course explores interior design and trains you to professionally decorate building interiors.
description: This diploma course provides an overview of interior design as a discipline and career. We delve into topics like project planning and client communication to help you ground your new understanding of design principles in practical business lessons. We explain how to work with colour and make the most of surface materials, textures, textiles, accessories, furniture, art and more. This diploma course suits anyone who wants to make rooms beautiful.

courseDescription:
This diploma course teaches you everything you need to know to launch a career in interior design. We cover the artistic side of the job and outline the practical business issues you need to consider to start your own business or work on a freelance basis.

The course begins by introducing you to key aspects of project planning and client communication. We demonstrate how to employ colour to make the best use of surface materials and textures. We then show you how to work with textiles and accessories and how to find and select the right furniture to make the most of the available space.

We provide practical instructions and demonstrations to help you grasp important design principles and factors to consider when working with a particular space. While our emphasis is on residential spaces, the course also suits those looking to design commercial interiors. We can help you to turn a passion for decor into a career as you learn how to turn building interiors into works of art. Each room can be a canvas awaiting your hand so sign up to become an interior designer.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this diploma course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this diploma course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison diploma is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital diploma: a downloadable diploma in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • diploma: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked diploma, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed diploma: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked diploma in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All diploma are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison diploma, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison diploma, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our diploma pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn about what is meant by the terms “interior design” and “interior designer”, the tasks carried on a day to day basis, education paths into the profession as well as career prospects.
topics: What is Interior Design? - Learning Outcomes

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will learn why every interior design project begins with a set of preliminary diagrams and a floor plan, the basic principles of design that should be followed. As well as an overview of the tools interior designers use to plan how a space can be structured.
topics: Project Planning and Client Communications - Learning Outcomes
Project Planning and Client Communication - Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will be introduced to why each room in a house or commercial setting warrants special consideration, what to consider when designing these different types to spaces and how to ensure that the spaces you design are accessible to those with disabilities.
topics: Planning Rooms and Spaces - Learning Outcomes

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will be introduced to why you need to understand the role played by colour in interior design, colour psychology and its application in interior design, and using neutral tones and colour schemes. In addition, you will also find out about how to use the colour wheel when decorating an interior and Classic colour “rules” and their rationale.
topics: Colour in Interior Design - Learning Outcomes

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to why surfaces and textures are key components of interior design, common surface materials used in interior design and how a designer can realise their full potential. In addition you will learn about common finishes and textures used on walls, doors and ceilings and why and how a designer may select a particular texture for use in an interior.
topics: Surface Materials and Textures – Learning Outcomes

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Diploma in Interior Design - First Assessment
modules.description: This is the first assessment in the Interior Design Diploma course. You will be tested on your knowledge of the first half of the course content.
topics: Diploma in Interior Design - First Assessment

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to why designers need to consider light sources within a space, the three main types of lighting used in residential and commercial spaces and the key issues that must be confronted when working with natural and artificial light. You will also learn how to choose appropriate light fixtures, including bulbs and how to achieve a variety of special lighting effects.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will be introduced to why you should aim to develop an understanding of the history of furniture, the most popular interior design styles in use today and how to select the right piece of furniture for a space. You will also learn how to source furniture in an efficient, cost-effective manner and how to customise a piece of furniture.
topics: Sourcing and Selecting Furniture - Lesson Outcomes
Sourcing and Selecting Furniture - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will be introduced to why textiles and accessories are important in interior design, the most common natural and synthetic fibres in use today and the advantages and disadvantages of working with leather. You will also learn how fibres are converted into textiles and how each is typically used in interior design, the most common accessories used in interior design and how to use accessories to their full potential.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn why you need to understand and implement sustainable and ethical design practices, how to devise environmentally friendly designs at the earliest stages of a project and how to minimise the effects of painting and decorating on the environment. You will also learn how to source materials, furniture and accessories in an ethical manner that promotes corporate responsibility and how to dispose of waste products and unwanted items.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will learn about practical considerations to bear in mind when setting up your business, including the appropriate selection of an office space and the tools you will need to get started, how to register as self-employed and your legal obligations and the procedures you need to follow, including income tax and health and safety legislation.
topics: Business of Interior Design - Learning Outcomes
Business of Interior Design - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Diploma in Interior Design - Second Assessment
modules.description: This is the second assessment in the Interior Design Diploma course. You will be tested on your knowledge of the second half of the course content.
topics: Diploma in Interior Design - Second Assessment

modules.name: Module
topics: Diploma in Interior Design - End of Course Assessment

slides:
• What is Interior Design? 

  •  
    After studying this module you will be able to: 
    • Describe what is meant by the terms “interior design” and “interior designer”
    • Explain the tasks carried out by interior designers on a day to day basis
    • Describe the main steps involved in overseeing an interior design project
    • Give reasons for why interior design is a valuable discipline
    • Know the qualities essential for a successful career as an interior designer
    • Understand the  training and qualification options for those looking to become an interior designer
    • Understand career prospects and average salary bands for interior designers

  • What is Interior Design? 

  •  
    After studying this module you will be able to: 
    • Describe what is meant by the terms “interior design” and “interior designer”
    • Explain the tasks carried out by interior designers on a day to day basis
    • Describe the main steps involved in overseeing an interior design project
    • Give reasons for why interior design is a valuable discipline
    • Know the qualities essential for a successful career as an interior designer
    • Understand the  training and qualification options for those looking to become an interior designer
    • Understand career prospects and average salary bands for interior designers
